what: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
text: DR() function provides marginal probability invasive listeriosis given population given Dose CFU using JEMRA, Pouillot, Fritsch, EFSA dose-response models model developed within project (EFSAMV,EFSAV,EFSALV) (see References).

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
code: DR(   Dose,   model = "JEMRA",   population = 1,   Poisson = FALSE,   method = "integrate",   ... )

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
text: Dose average dose CFU/serving assuming Poisson distribution serving serving (scalar vector) model either JEMRA, Pouillot, Fritsch, EFSA, EFSAMV,EFSAV EFSALV population considered population (scalar vector) (see ) Poisson TRUE, assume Dose mean Poisson distribution. (actual LogNormal Poisson). FALSE (default), assume Dose actual number bacteria. method either integrate cubature specify integration method. ... arguments pass DRLogNormPoisson() function

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
text: vector size Dose (population scalar) matrix dimension (length Dose vector times length population vector)

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
text: Pouillot, Fritsch, EFSA EFSAMV,EFSAV EFSALV model, integrates log10Normal Poisson distribution Pouillot et al. (2015) . log10Normal-binomial distribution. JEMRA model exponential dose-response model binomial model used. function slow. Use DRQuick() production. See parameters JEMRA report. method = "cubature" use hcubature function much slower guarantees tolerance \(1E-5\).

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis — DR
text: EFSA (2018). “Scientific opinion Listeria monocytogenes contamination ready--eat foods risk human health EU.” EFSA Journal, 16(1), 5134. FAO-(2004). “Risk assessment Listeria monocytogenes ready--eat foods: Technical report.” World Health Organization Food Agriculture Organization United Nations. Fritsch L, Guillier L, Augustin J (2018). “Next generation quantitative microbiological risk assessment: Refinement cold smoked salmon-related listeriosis risk model integrating genomic data.” Microbial Risk Analysis, 10, 20--27. doi:10.1016/j.mran.2018.06.003 . Pouillot R, Hoelzer K, Chen Y, Dennis SB (2015). “Listeria monocytogenes dose response revisited--incorporating adjustments variability strain virulence host susceptibility.” Risk Analysis, 35(1), 90--108. doi:10.1111/risa.12235 .

what: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
text: function DRLogNormPoisson() provides marginal probability invasive listeriosis given population given Dose CFU. function vectorized.

title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
code: DRLogNormPoisson(   Dose,   meanlog10,   sdlog10,   Poisson = FALSE,   low = -Inf,   up = Inf,   silent = TRUE,   tol = 1e-20,   method = "integrate",   ... )

title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
text: Dose (CFU/serving) Dose (scalar vector). integers Poisson FALSE. meanlog10 meanlog10 parameter distribution r (parameter exponential model). sdlog10 sdlog10 parameter distribution r (parameter exponential model). Poisson TRUE, assume Dose mean Poisson distribution. (actual LogNormal Poisson). FALSE (default), assume Dose actual number bacteria. low lower value integration. upper value integration. silent silent error-try function. tol relative tolerance. Note: method = "cubature", tolerance set \(1E-05\). method either "integrate" (default) "cubature" specify integration method. ... arguments pass integrate function.

title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
text: Probability invasive listeriosis integrated r.

title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
text: function evaluates $$\int_{low}^{inf} \Phi(x, mulog_{10}, sdlog_{10})\cdot(1-e^{(-Dose \cdot 10^{r})}) dr$$ using integrate function, relative tolerance equals tol Poisson TRUE. Poisson FALSE, evaluates $$\int_{low}^{inf} \Phi(x, mulog_{10}, sdlog_{10})\cdot(1-(1-10^{r})^{Dose}) dr$$. method = "cubature", tolerance set \(1E-5\). method = "cubature" use \link[cubature]{hcubature} function much slower guarantees tolerance \(1E-5\).

title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson
text: function used DR() function, wrapper DRLogNormPoisson(). quick, vectorized version , use DRQuick().

title: Marginal probability of invasive listeriosis over r — DRLogNormPoisson

Dose-response model function for listeriosis - quick version — DRQuick
text: Dose (CFU/serving) Dose (scalar vector). model either JEMRA, Pouillot, Fritsch, EFSA, EFSAMV,EFSAV EFSALV population considered population (scalar vector). Poisson TRUE, assume Dose mean Poisson distribution. (actual LogNormal Poisson). FALSE (default), assume Dose actual number bacteria.

text: vector size Dose (population scalar) matrix dimension (length Dose vector x length population vector)

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis - quick version — DRQuick
text: See parameters JEMRA report.

title: Dose-response model function for listeriosis - quick version — DRQuick
text: function uses (model JEMRA) linear approximation (approxfun) exact DR() model evaluated \(Dose = c(0,10^{seq(-5,12,length=1701)})\) (Poisson=TRUE) \(c(0,10^{seq(0,12,length=2000)})\) (Poisson=FALSE). Dose lower higher ranges lead NA.
